00049 //
00050 // ContextSimpleCountCollectorCopier
00051 //
00052 // 5 March 2004 -- tds
00053 //
00054 // This copier uses a IndriIndex to extract context
00055 // counts for certain simple subgraphs.  It can compute
00056 // counts for the following types of expressions:
00057 //
00058 //   dog
00059 //   <dog cat>
00060 //   dog.title
00061 //   <dog cat>.title
00062 //   dog.(title)
00063 //   <dog cat>.(title)
00064 //   
00065 // Notably, it is unable to compute counts when more than
00066 // one field is involved.
00067 //
00068 
00069 #ifndef INDRI_CONTEXTSIMPLECOUNTCOLLECTORCOPIER_HPP
00070 #define INDRI_CONTEXTSIMPLECOUNTCOLLECTORCOPIER_HPP
00071 
00072 #include "indri/QuerySpec.hpp"
00073 #include "indri/Copier.hpp"
00074 #include "indri/delete_range.hpp"
00075 #include "indri/Repository.hpp"
00076 #include "indri/IndriIndex.hpp"
00077 #include "indri/ListCache.hpp"
00078 
00079 class ContextSimpleCountCollectorCopier : public indri::lang::Copier {
00080 private:
00081   std::vector<indri::lang::Node*> _newNodes;
00082   Repository& _repository;
00083   IndriIndex& _index;
00084   ListCache& _cache;
00085 
00086   class SubtreeWalker : public indri::lang::Walker {
00087   private:
00088     bool _computable;
00089     int _extentOrs;
00090     bool _hasContext;
00091 
00092     std::vector<indri::lang::IndexTerm*> _terms;
00093     indri::lang::Field* _field;
00094 
00095   public:
00096     SubtreeWalker() :
00097       _computable(true),
00098       _extentOrs(0),
00099       _field(0)
00100     {
00101     }
00102 
00103     bool isComputable() {
00104       return _computable && _terms.size();
00105     }
00106 
00107     std::vector<indri::lang::IndexTerm*>& getTerms() {
00108       return _terms;
00109     }
00110 
00111     indri::lang::Field* getField() {
00112       return _field;
00113     }
00114 
00115     bool hasContext() const {
00116       return _hasContext;
00117     }
00118 
00119     void defaultBefore( indri::lang::Node* node ) {
00120       // this means that we're seeing some node type that
00121       // we aren't otherwise trapping--that means this subtree
00122       // is surely not precomputable
00123       _computable = false;
00124     }
00125 
00126     void before( indri::lang::ContextCounterNode* contextNode ) {
00127       // if the context node has a context, then it must have a field in the context
00128       // if we find more than one field, we say this isn't computable.  Therefore, if
00129       // this subtree is computable and it has a context, the single field must be in the context.
00130       _hasContext = contextNode->getContext() ? true : false;
00131     }
00132     
00133     void before( indri::lang::ExtentOr* extentOrNode ) {
00134       _extentOrs++;
00135     }
00136 
00137     void after( indri::lang::ExtentOr* extentOrNode ) {
00138       _extentOrs--;
00139     }
00140 
00141     void before( indri::lang::ExtentAnd* extentAndNode ) {
00142       // we definitely can't deal with any "true" extentAnds
00143       // however, if this is just an and wrapper around a single
00144       // field, we won't let it fool us
00145       if( extentAndNode->getChildren().size() > 1 )
00146         _computable = false;
00147     }
00148 
00149     void before( indri::lang::Field* fieldNode ) {
00150       if( _extentOrs || _field ) {
00151         // fields can't be or-ed together; only terms can (_extentOr)
00152         // If we already saw a field, then this one proves that the tree isn't computable (_field)
00153         _computable = false;
00154       }
00155 
00156       _field = fieldNode;
00157     }
00158 
00159     void before( indri::lang::IndexTerm* termNode ) {
00160       _terms.push_back(termNode);
00161     }
00162 
00163     void before( indri::lang::ExtentInside* insideNode ) {
00164       // ignore this; the other checks should catch any bad trees
00165       // without having to worry about checking here
00166     }
00167   };
00168 
00169   void _computeRestrictedCounts( indri::lang::ContextCounterNode* contextNode, SubtreeWalker& subtree ) {
00170     UINT64 occurrences = 0;
00171     UINT64 size;
00172 
00173     assert( subtree.isComputable() );
00174     assert( subtree.getField() );
00175 
00176     // get the fieldID
00177     int fieldID = _index.field( subtree.getField()->getFieldName().c_str() );
00178 
00179     if( subtree.hasContext() ) {
00180       size = _index.fieldTermCount( fieldID );
00181     } else {
00182       size = _index.termCount();
00183     }
00184 
00185     std::vector<indri::lang::IndexTerm*>& terms = subtree.getTerms();
00186     for( unsigned int i=0; i<terms.size(); i++ ) {
00187       std::string processed = terms[i]->getText();
00188       if( terms[i]->getStemmed() == false )
00189         processed = _repository.processTerm( terms[i]->getText() );
00190 
00191       if( processed.length() != 0 ) {
00192         int termID = _index.term( processed.c_str() );
00193         occurrences += _index.fieldTermCount( fieldID, termID );
00194       }
00195     }
00196 
00197     contextNode->setCounts( occurrences, size );
00198   }
00199 
00200   void _computeUnrestrictedCounts( indri::lang::ContextCounterNode* contextNode, SubtreeWalker& subtree ) {
00201     assert( subtree.isComputable() );
00202     assert( !subtree.getField() );
00203 
00204     UINT64 occurrences = 0;
00205     UINT64 size = 0;
00206 
00207     UINT64 maxOccurrences = 0;
00208     UINT64 maxContextSize = 0;
00209     UINT64 minContextSize = MAX_INT64;
00210     double maxDocumentFraction = 0;
00211 
00212     std::vector<indri::lang::IndexTerm*>& terms = subtree.getTerms();
00213     for( unsigned int i=0; i<terms.size(); i++ ) {
00214       std::string processed = terms[i]->getText();
00215       if( terms[i]->getStemmed() == false )
00216         processed = _repository.processTerm( terms[i]->getText() );
00217 
00218       if( processed.length() != 0 ) {
00219         int termID = _index.term( processed.c_str() );
00220         occurrences += _index.termCount( termID );
00221 
00222         maxOccurrences += _index.termMaxDocumentFrequency( termID );
00223         minContextSize = lemur_compat::min<UINT64>( _index.termMinDocumentLength( termID ), minContextSize );
00224 
00225         maxDocumentFraction += _index.termMaxDocumentFraction( termID );
00226         maxDocumentFraction = lemur_compat::min<double>( 1.0, maxDocumentFraction );
00227       }
00228     }
00229 
00230     maxContextSize = _index.maxDocumentLength();
00231 
00232     size = _index.termCount();
00233     contextNode->setCounts( occurrences, size, maxOccurrences, minContextSize, maxContextSize, maxDocumentFraction );
00234   }
00235 
00236   void _computeCounts( indri::lang::ContextCounterNode* contextNode, SubtreeWalker& subtree ) {
00237     assert( subtree.isComputable() );
00238 
00239     if( subtree.getField() ) {
00240       _computeRestrictedCounts( contextNode, subtree );
00241     } else {
00242       _computeUnrestrictedCounts( contextNode, subtree );
00243     }
00244   }
00245 
00246   void _setCountsFromList( indri::lang::ContextCounterNode* contextNode, ListCache::CachedList* list ) {
00247     contextNode->setCounts( list->occurrences,
00248                             list->contextSize, 
00249                             list->maximumOccurrences,
00250                             list->minimumContextSize, 
00251                             list->maximumContextSize,
00252                             list->maximumContextFraction );
00253     contextNode->setRawExtent( 0 );
00254     contextNode->setContext( 0 );
00255   }
00256 
00257 public:
00258   ContextSimpleCountCollectorCopier( Repository& repository, ListCache& cache ) :
00259     _repository(repository),
00260     _index(*repository.index()),
00261     _cache(cache)
00262   {
00263   }
00264 
00265   ~ContextSimpleCountCollectorCopier() {
00266     delete_vector_contents<indri::lang::Node*>( _newNodes );
00267   }
00268 
00269   indri::lang::Node* defaultAfter( indri::lang::Node* oldNode, indri::lang::Node* newNode ) {
00270     _newNodes.push_back( newNode );
00271     return newNode;
00272   }
00273 
00274   indri::lang::Node* after( indri::lang::ContextCounterNode* contextNode, indri::lang::ContextCounterNode* newNode ) {
00275     ListCache::CachedList* list = _cache.find( newNode->getRawExtent(), newNode->getContext() );
00276 
00277     if( list ) {
00278       _setCountsFromList( newNode, list );
00279     } else {
00280       // first, walk the subtree to find out if it's computable
00281       SubtreeWalker subtree;
00282       contextNode->walk(subtree);
00283     
00284       if( subtree.isComputable() ) {
00285         // compute it, then cut off the subtree
00286         _computeCounts( newNode, subtree );
00287         newNode->setRawExtent( 0 );
00288         newNode->setContext( 0 );
00289       } else if( newNode->getContext() == 0 ) {
00290         // we can't figure out how many term occurrences
00291         // there are in this thing, but at least we know
00292         // how big the context size is, so set it
00293         newNode->setContextSize( _index.termCount() );
00294       }
00295     }
00296 
00297     // if it wasn't computable, keep the subtree around so the
00298     // inference network code can run it and figure out the counts
00299     _newNodes.push_back( newNode );
00300     return newNode;
00301   }
00302 };
00303 
00304 #endif // INDRI_CONTEXTSIMPLECOUNTCOLLECTORCOPIER_HPP
